modules.title: Software Engineering
modules.description: Introduction to the principles of software engineering, development methodologies, and best practices.

quiz.question: What does SDLC stand for?
Which methodology focuses on incremental development?
What is a UML diagram?
Which is the first phase of the SDLC?
Which tool is commonly used for version control?
What is refactoring?
options: Changing the software design without affecting functionality
quiz.answer: Changing the software design without affecting functionality

quiz.question: What is a use case diagram?
options: A diagram to represent class relationships
A diagram for interaction between users and the system
quiz.answer: A diagram for interaction between users and the system

quiz.question: Which phase comes after the testing phase in SDLC?
What is the purpose of unit testing?
options: To test individual components or functions of software
quiz.answer: To test individual components or functions of software

quiz.question: Which of these is a popular Agile framework?
What is the goal of software design?
options: To ensure the software is scalable, maintainable, and efficient
quiz.answer: To ensure the software is scalable, maintainable, and efficient

quiz.question: What is the purpose of an object-oriented design?
options: To organize software into classes and objects

quiz.question: What is pair programming?
options: Two developers working on the same code simultaneously
Programming alone to complete tasks quickly
quiz.answer: Two developers working on the same code simultaneously

quiz.question: What is the primary advantage of using Agile methodology?
options: It allows for rapid development and constant feedback
It is suitable only for large projects
quiz.answer: It allows for rapid development and constant feedback

modules.title: Cyber Security
modules.description: Covers basic concepts of cyber security, threats, and defenses.

quiz.question: What does VPN stand for?
What is a DDoS attack?
Which of these is a common method of phishing?
Which tool is used to scan for vulnerabilities in systems?
What is the main purpose of a firewall?
options: To protect systems from unauthorized access
quiz.answer: To protect systems from unauthorized access

quiz.question: What does ransomware do?
Which of these is a security protocol?
What is two-factor authentication?
options: A system that requires two forms of identification
quiz.answer: A system that requires two forms of identification

quiz.question: Which of these is a type of malware?
What is the principle of least privilege?
options: Users should have the minimum level of access necessary
Users should be able to access everything
Users should not have any privileges
quiz.answer: Users should have the minimum level of access necessary

quiz.question: Which of these is not a cyber attack?
What is a botnet?
options: A network of infected computers controlled by a hacker
quiz.answer: A network of infected computers controlled by a hacker

quiz.question: What is a keylogger?

modules.title: Networking
modules.description: Covers the fundamentals of computer networks, protocols, and network security.

quiz.question: What does TCP stand for?
Which protocol is used for secure communication on the internet?
What is an IP address?
What does DNS stand for?
Which of the following is a type of network topology?
What is the function of a router?
options: Send data to the same network

quiz.question: What is the primary role of a switch?
options: To connect multiple devices on a network
To route data to external networks
quiz.answer: To connect multiple devices on a network

quiz.question: What is a subnet mask?
options: A method for dividing IP addresses into subnets
quiz.answer: A method for dividing IP addresses into subnets

quiz.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for data encryption?
What is the maximum length of an Ethernet cable?
Which port does HTTP usually use?
Which of the following is used for wireless communication?

modules.title: Database Management
modules.description: An introduction to database design, normalization, and SQL querying.

quiz.question: What does SQL stand for?
What is normalization in a database?
Which SQL clause is used to filter records?
What is a primary key?
options: A unique identifier for each record in a table
A column used to filter records
quiz.answer: A unique identifier for each record in a table

quiz.question: Which SQL statement is used to delete data from a table?
What is the purpose of a foreign key?
Which of these is a type of database?
What does the JOIN clause do in SQL?
options: Combines rows from two or more tables
quiz.answer: Combines rows from two or more tables

quiz.question: What is a database index?
options: A method to speed up data retrieval
quiz.answer: A method to speed up data retrieval

quiz.question: Which SQL command is used to create a new table?
What does the COUNT() function do in SQL?
